spirals.title: LTER Completeness-Identification
spirals.description: Minimum content for adequate data set discovery in a general cataloging system or repository (functionally equivalent to LTER DTOC)

items.name: Resource Identifier
items.description: Identifier for the resource described by the metadata

items.name: Resource Title
items.description: A short description of the resource. The title should be descriptive enough so that when a user is presented with a list of titles the general content of the data set can be determined.

items.name: Author / Originator
items.note: In CSW this concept is called Creator
items.description: The principal author of the resource

items.name: Metadata Contact
items.description: The organization or person currently responsible for the metadata.

items.name: Contributor Name
items.description: Contributor to the resource

items.name: Publisher
items.description: Publisher of the cited resource

items.name: Publication Date
items.description: Date of publication of the cited resource

items.name: Resource Contact
items.description: The organization or person responsible for answering questions about the resource.

items.name: Abstract
items.note: This concept is called Desciption in Catalog Services for the Web.
items.description: A paragraph describing the resource.

items.name: Keyword
items.description: A word or phrase that describes some aspect of a resource. Can be one of several types.

items.name: Resource Distribution
items.description: Information about how the resource is available, online, offline, inline.

spirals.title: LTER Completeness-Discovery
spirals.description: Discovery level metadata should provide as much information as possible to support locating datasets by time, taxa, and/or geographic location in addition to basic identification information. Discovery level EML should include the coverage elements of temporalCoverage (when), taxonomicCoverage (what), and geographicCoverage (where) for the dataset as well as the change history in the maintenance element.

items.name: Taxonomic Extent
items.description: The extent of the taxonomies coverage.

items.name: Spatial Extent
items.description: The spatial extent of the resource.

items.name: Temporal Extent
items.description: The temporal extent of the resource

items.name: Maintenance
items.description: Describes changes to the data tables or metadata, including update frequency.

spirals.title: LTER Completeness-Evaluation
spirals.description: Evaluation level metadata should include detailed descriptions of the project, methods, protocols, and intellectual rights in order for a potential user to evaluate the relevance of the data package for their research study or synthesis project.

items.name: Resource Use Constraints
items.description: Information about how the data may or may not be used after access is granted to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property. This includes any special restrictions, legal prerequisites, terms and conditions, and/or limitations on using the data set. Data providers may request acknowledgement of the data from users and claim no responsibility for quality and completeness of data.

items.name: Process Step
items.description: A step in the processing that produced a resource

items.name: Project Description
items.description: Description of the project.

items.name: Entity Type Definition
items.description: The description of the entity type

items.name: Attribute Definition
items.description: The description of the attribute

spirals.title: LTER Completeness-Access
spirals.description: Access-level metadata should provide a user with all the information needed to access and download the data tables, even if the tablesâ€™ attributes are not thoroughly described. The tags required at this level specify access control and the physical description of the table.

items.name: Resource Access Constraints
items.description: Information about any constraints for accessing the data set. This includes any special restrictions, legal prerequisites, limitations and/or warnings on obtaining the data set. Some words that may be used in this field include: Public, In-house, Limited, Additional detailed instructions on how to access the data can be entered in this field.

items.name: Resource Format
items.description: The physical or digital manifestation of the resource

spirals.title: LTER Completeness-Integration
spirals.description: Integration-level metadata should support computer-mediated access and processing of data, and therefore requires that all aspects of the data package be fully described.

items.name: Attribute List
items.description: A description of the attributes a data table's entities have.

items.name: Attribute Constraints
items.description: Describes constraints on attributes such as a foriegn key in a database.

items.name: Resource Quality Description
items.note: ISO-1 provides free text fields for describing quality information in the DQ_MeasureReference, DQ_EvaluationMethod, and DQ_DescriptiveResult objects.
items.description: Description of the quality of the resource or any quality assurance procedures followed in producing the resource.
